```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```
```{r}

# Read CSV File
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1 <- read.csv("Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1.csv")



#1. Print out the 5-point summary and boxplot (numerical columns) for each column

summary(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1)              # shows min, 1st Qu., Median, 3rd Qu., Max
boxplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1, las=2)       # boxplots for numeric columns (las=2 makes labels vertical)

#2. Convert the columns that need to be converted to Factors

Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$GENDER <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$GENDER)    # change "GENDER" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBSATISFACTION <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBSATISFACTION) # change "JOBSATISFACTION" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$IMPJOBCHAR <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$IMPJOBCHAR) # change "IMPJOBCHAR" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$PROMOTIONAL <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$PROMOTIONAL) # change "PROMOTIONAL" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$DECISIONS <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$DECISIONS) # change "DECISIONS" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$BUD.DEC <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$BUD.DEC) # change "BUD.DEC" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$ORGANIZATIONS <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$ORGANIZATIONS) # change "ORGANIZATIONS" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBCHUMFORPAYLIKELIHOOD <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBCHUMFORPAYLIKELIHOOD) # change "JOBCHUMFORPAYLIKELIHOOD" column to factor
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$REALATION <- as.factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$REALATION) # change "REALATION" column to factor
str(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1) 

#3. Plot the right visual for each column
# AGE (numeric) → histogram
hist(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$AGE, main="Histogram of Age", xlab="Age")

# GENDER (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$GENDER), main="Barplot of Gender", xlab="Gender")

# JOBSATISFACTION (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBSATISFACTION), main="Barplot of Job Satisfaction", xlab="Satisfaction Level")

# IMPJOBCHAR (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$IMPJOBCHAR), main="Barplot of Important Job Characteristics", xlab="Importance Level")

# YRSINJOB (numeric) → histogram
hist(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$YRSINJOB, main="Histogram of Years in Job", xlab="Years in Job")

# PROMOTIONAL (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$PROMOTIONAL), main="Barplot of Promotional Opportunities", xlab="Opportunities")

# DECISIONS (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$DECISIONS), main="Barplot of Decisions", xlab="Decision Level")

# BUD.DEC (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$BUD.DEC), main="Barplot of Budget Decisions", xlab="Budget Decisions")

# ORGANIZATIONS (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$ORGANIZATIONS), main="Barplot of Organizations", xlab="Organizations")

# JOBCHUMFORPAYLIKELIHOOD (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$JOBCHUMFORPAYLIKELIHOOD), main="Barplot of Job Change Likelihood", xlab="Likelihood")

# REALATION (categorical) → barplot
barplot(table(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$REALATION), main="Barplot of Relation", xlab="Relation Level")


#4. Plot scatter plots to show few relationships
plot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$AGE, Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$YRSINJOB, main="Age vs Years in Job", xlab="Age", ylab="Years in Job")
plot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$AGE, Typical_Employee_Survey_Data1$PROMOTIONAL, main="Age vs Promotional", xlab="Age", ylab="Promotional Opportunities")

```
